title: U.S. Stock Futures Waver After Hitting Fresh Records
sub_head: Starbucks, Microsoft and Texas Instruments will report earnings after markets close
body:
U.S. stock futures were little changed after major indexes hit records a day earlier and investors got ready for a slew of blue-chip earnings.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 wavered between gains and losses, indicating the benchmark gauge may open flat after notching a record high Monday. Futures for the technology-focused Nasdaq-100 index fell 0.1% and contracts tied to the Dow Jones Industrial Average edged 0.2% higher.
This week marks the height of earnings season, with shares of General Electric rallying 9.2% premarket after the industrial conglomerate reported forecast-beating fourth-quarter revenue and free cash flow.
Johnson & Johnson rose 1.8% in premarket trade after it recorded stronger sales in its latest quarter, as revenue gains from its pharmaceutical division boosted its top-line results. Raytheon Technologies rose 2.5% after the aerospace and defense company reported fourth-quarter profit and revenue that beat expectations.
Starbucks , Microsoft and Texas Instruments will release results after markets close. Major tech firms, including Apple , Tesla and Facebook , will update investors Wednesday.
